item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/11/13/business-model-impact/#comment-4112">julien51</a>.
Business models also tend not to change very often, hence one of the reasons they have a contributing factor.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

Business models also tend not to change very often, hence one of the reasons they have a contributing factor.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description: Agreed. It's too easy to say that everything in a company comes from their business models. People work there and they can make a choice. Even Google is NOT just a machine. Poeple work there, engineers, designers, product managers and they are the ones making decisions based on many factors, one of them being the business model, but it's just one of them.
item.content:encoded:
Agreed. It’s too easy to say that everything in a company comes from their business models. People work there and they can make a choice.
Even Google is NOT just a machine. Poeple work there, engineers, designers, product managers and they are the ones making decisions based on many factors, one of them being the business model, but it’s just one of them.
